intro: Senecio gummifer, commonly known as the stickyweed or gum plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky resin. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. Senecio gummifer is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
